headline: Kitsune Worship and Delusional Devotion
article:
A fervent discussion revolves around the worship of kitsune (fox spirits), blending folklore, personal delusions, and extreme devotion. One user claims, *"Any LUNAtics giving the foxes BLOOD during the BLOOD MOON? You will get a special BLOOD red foxwife while supplies last."* Others express paranoia about "anti-fox forces" suppressing their beliefs, with one declaring, *"Damn them! They must be the same people killing these threads! And stopping my Fox wife from getting to me!"* Some threaten violence, stating, *"I can incinerate their families on camera if anyone moves more than 5 inches."*  

A recurring figure is "Timmy," a nickname for Tamamo no Mae, a legendary kitsune. One user insists, *"Tamamo no Mae is Christ and Christ is King. Also she prefers to be called Timmy."* Others mock this belief, with one retorting, *"She escaped the rock to erase our sins (and then kill us)."*  

Conspiracy theories emerge, including a warning about a Southeast Asian cult grooming men with kitsune promises, leading to prostitution. Skeptics dismiss it, with one replying, *"I see no negatives here so I will continue. Frankly I see an upside."*  

Tulpas (imaginary companions) are discussed, with one user sharing, *"My tulpa temporarily started taking on the form of Fate’s Timmy."* Others deride this as delusional, arguing, *"You tuplafags are the biggest larpers ever, literally making up imaginary friends."*  

The thread devolves into insults, with fox lovers and haters clashing. One user declares, *"Foxes are always good. They can sense good souls,"* while another counters, *"Nothing is 'always' except God. Fxoes don’t like me because I’m a problem for them."* The debate remains unresolved, steeped in paranoia and fervent belief.
